articles.title: Greetings to Armenian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Armenian President
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Serge Sarkissian, president of Armenia, on Sept. 21 on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the president good health and great success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Guinea-Bissau
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Jose Mario Vaz, president of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau, on Sept. 20 on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would invariably grow stronger and wished the president and people of Guinea-Bissau successes in their work for the national unity and stability and the development of the country's economy.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Film Festival
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Film Festival
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the participants in the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival on Wednesday. 
					 The letter said the film festival which proved fruitful thanks to the sincere efforts and cooperation of the Festival Organizing Committee and foreign movie-men became a significant occasion of achieving common prosperity of mankind, strengthening friendship and bonds among movie-men of different countries and promoting development of national films. 
					
					 It extended thanks to Kim Jong Un for paying deep attention to the festival so that from its opening ceremony to closing ceremony it was successfully held, and according warm hospitality to its participants. 
					
					 Brief as our stay in Pyongyang was, we witnessed with great emotion the eye-opening reality of the DPRK in which beautiful dreams and ideals of the Korean people are coming true under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un and came to have conviction that the future of the Korean people will be rosier thanks to his energetic and devoted leadership, the letter said.
					
					 The great exploits and greatness of Kim Jong Un pursuing politics of love for the people true to the noble intentions of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, eternal sun of Juche, will shine long amid praises of all people, it noted. 
					
					 We steering justice and goodwill will as ever produce good films to sincerely take part in the Pyongyang International Film Festival whose tenet is independence, peace and friendship, it said.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Scientific Symposium
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Participants of Int'l Scientific Symposium
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Wednesday received a letter from the participants of the International Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University.
					 The symposium held on the theme "Korean linguistics, literature and history" proved to be a significant international gathering as it helped the participants have a wealth of knowledge of written and spoken Korean language and literary legacies and its long history and deep understanding of the picture of the DPRK making a leap forward with youthful vigor in the new century, the letter said, adding:
					
					 All the participants achieved many successes in getting proper understanding of the Korean language the advantages of which are demonstrated before the world under the Korean-style socialist system developed by President Kim Il Sung and Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il, eternal leaders of the Korean people, and the Korean history which boasts its precious literary legacies and its unique culture.
					
					 Witnessing the courageous struggle of the Korean people dynamically advancing for the building of a thriving socialist nation while creating the Korean speed startling the world despite the complicated situation under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, we are firmly convinced of the rosy future of the DPRK.
					
					 The participants will make positive efforts to reenergize scientific cooperation and exchange helpful to the socialist construction in the DPRK and the development of high civilization of different countries and nations in the future, too, on the basis of the successes and experience gained in the symposium.
					
					 Rosy is the prospect for the building of a thriving socialist nation in the DPRK thanks to Kim Jong Un who clearly indicates the road of developing linguistics, literature and history of the country based on great Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism and Kim Jong Il's patriotism and the resourceful and highly civilized Korean people who are single-mindedly united around him.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Far-fetched Assertion to Justify U.S. Permanent Presence in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. Far-fetched Assertion to Justify U.S. Permanent Presence in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean warlike forces at their recent talks mainly discussed the issue of extending the transfer of wartime operation control (OPECON) well beyond 2020 though it had been scheduled for next year. Explaining the reason for the extension, the U.S. claims that south Korea is not capable of coping with the escalating "nuclear and missile threat" from the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is nothing but a U.S. cunning and despicable trick to perpetuate its troops' presence in south Korea under the pretext of "threat" from the DPRK, 
					
					 The U.S. is making a far-fetched assertion to justify its forces' permanent presence in south Korea.
					
					 There is no justification for the U.S. troops to stay in south Korea any longer at present. 
					
					 However, shutting its eyes to this stark reality, the U.S. desperately seeks its forces' permanent presence in south Korea, pulling up the DPRK. It is its view that this serves the purpose of its strategy for dominating the world by force of arms.
					
					 The U.S. calculates that its troops in south Korea will play a main role in keeping its military strategic edge in Northeast Asia. That is why the U.S. leaves no means untried to perpetuate its forces' presence in south Korea. Precisely for this reason it cites "threat" from the DPRK in a bid to justify their presence and is becoming talkative about extension of OPECON. 
					
					 It admits of no argument that the U.S. troops in south Korea are the root cause of disturbing peace on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of Northeast Asia and bringing the dark clouds of a war to hang over Korea.

articles.title: Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Their Anti-DPRK Leaflets Scattering Operation
articles.content:
Minju Joson Denounces S. Korean Authorities for Their Anti-DPRK Leaflets Scattering Operation
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities let human scum of the "Alliance for the Movement of Free North," the organization of the vicious "defectors from the north," scatter leaflets slandering the DPRK again.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is an undisguised challenge to the DPRK's principled demand for putting an end to the leaflet scattering operation against it and a heinous treacherous and anti-reunification confrontation racket for pushing the inter-Korean relations to the worst catastrophe.
					
					  The recent leaflets scattering operation is part of the anti-DPRK psychological warfare conducted at the tacit connivance of the puppet group and under its zealous backing.
					
					 Such operation was carried out at a time when the 17th Asian Games are now under way in Inchon in which the DPRK's players' group is also taking part.
					
					 This fact clearly proves that the puppet group is hordes of hooligans without equals as it is chilling the atmosphere of reconciliation and reunification prevailing in the games in pursuance of confrontation with the north, being utterly indifferent to the international games and the sincerity of the fellow countrymen participating in the games.
					
					 The army and the people of the DPRK will never let those who masterminded the operation for scattering leaflets slandering the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and others involved in it go scot-free but mete out a stern punishment to them any time and any place by employing any means and method.
					
					 The puppet group will be held wholly accountable for all consequences to be entailed by the anti-DPRK leaflets scattering operation. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime has no face to talk about "dialogue" and "confidence" any longer as it made desperate efforts to seriously hurt the north and sever the inter-Korean relations through the above-said operation.

articles.title: Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Homage Paid to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Wednesday. They will take part in the 2nd Session of the 13th Supreme People's Assembly.
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state, the deputies paid homage to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il received are preserved and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Pay Tribute to Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Pay Tribute to Bust of Kim Jong Suk 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly to attend the Second Session of the 13th SPA laid a wreath and bunches of flowers before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Wednesday. 
					 They paid silent tribute to her, recollecting her revolutionary life.

articles.title: Foreign Diplomats Tour Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Tour Area of Mt. Paektu
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Staff members of foreign embassies and missions of international bodies here toured the area of Mt. Paektu from Sept. 21 to 23.
					 They placed bunches of flowers before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the Samjiyon Grand Monument and before the mosaic portraying the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the Paektusan Secret Camp and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Then they visited leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that he was born in the period of the anti-Japanese war and brought up as the great son of the guerrillas, they looked round historic relics preserved in the birthplace.
					
					 They also went round the Headquarters log cabin used by the President and other places.
					
					 Earlier, they went round the Samjiyon Grand Monument.
					
					 They climbed Mt. Paektu.
					
					 They enjoyed a bird's-eye view of peaks on the mountain.
					
					 They looked round the Paektu Museum and toured Rimyongsu Falls, etc.
					
					 They were present on invitation at the reception given by the Ryanggang Provincial People's Committee.

articles.title: Deputies to SPA Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Deputies to SPA Pay Floral Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Senior party, state and army officials including Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and Hwang Pyong So and deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Wednesday. They are to take part in the 2nd Session of the 13th the SPA. 
					 They laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Railways between Songdowon and Segil Opens to Traffic
articles.content:
Railways between Songdowon and Segil Opens to Traffic
 Wonsan, September 23 (KCNA) -- New railways between Songdowon Railway Station and Segil Railway Station opened to traffic and Songdowon Railway Station went operational with due ceremony Tuesday.
					 This service is available for members of the Korean Children's Union from across the country coming to the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un took a measure for building the railway station near the camp so that KCU members do not feel any slightest inconvenience and provided direct train service for them.
					
					 The modern Songdowon Railway Station well matches picturesque Songdowon, a scenic spot on the east coast.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were officials concerned, officials and employees in the field of railway transport, soldier-builders and employees of the camp.
					
					 Jon Kil Su, minister of Railways, made an inaugural address.
					
					 The first train left for Pyongyang amid warm send-off of the participants.

articles.title: Candlelight Action Staged in Seoul
articles.content:
Candlelight Action Staged in Seoul
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A candlelight action of citizens was held in Seoul on September 20 demanding the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The participants held that in order to build a safe society it is necessary to institute a special law granting the rights to investigate and indict those responsible for the disaster.
					
					 Earlier, there took place at Kwanghwamun Plaza a reading out of a declaration written by 304 writers and citizens in the meaning to honor the memory of 304 victims of the ferry Sewol disaster.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Demand Institution of Special Law
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Demand Institution of Special Law 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Koreans in New York, Los Angeles, Washington and Virginia states of the U.S. held a rally in New York on September 21 demanding the institution of a special law on the ferry Sewol, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 A joint statement was read out at the rally.
					
					 The south Korean chief executive has no willingness to settle the issue though she revealed her general incompetence in the course of the ferry Sewol disaster, it charged.
					
					 The present chief executive is chiefly to blame for the death of hundreds of children, it held.
					
					 It said that the bereaved families and people of all social standings of south Korea and Koreans in the U.S. demand the institution of a special law for a thoroughgoing and independent investigation.
					
					 Then the participants of the rally staged a demonstration. The demonstrators marched as far as the UN Headquarters. They held a rally again, strongly urging the puppet authorities of south Korea to opt for probing the truth about the disaster.

articles.title: Puppet Forces' Suppression of Teachers Union Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Puppet Forces' Suppression of Teachers Union Denounced in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Members of the Teachers Union of south Korea at a press conference in Seoul on September 22 denounced the puppet forces for getting frantic with the suppression of the union.
					 The speakers lashed out at the puppet Ministry of Employment and Labor for suppressing the union as evidenced by its action to exclude discharged teachers from the union, talking about the law on teachers union, an evil law.
					
					 The puppet Ministry of Education is also keen on cracking down on the union, they said.
					
					 They urged the "government" to apologize for suppression of the union and not to hold in check the just struggle of the teachers.
					
					 The "National Assembly" should also immediately come out for the revision of the law on the teachers union, they demanded.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for Participants of Film Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for Participants of Film Festival 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet hosted a reception at the People's Palace of Culture Wednesday in honor of the participants in the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival after its successful end. 
					 Present there on invitation were foreign delegations and delegates and members of the international jury who took part in the film festival. 
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture who is chairman of the Festival Organizing Committee, and officials concerned were present. 
					
					 Kim Yong Jin in a speech referred to the positive cooperation of the participants for the success of the festival, adding that the days of the festival will be always remembered by the participants.

articles.title: DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for Junior Footballers
articles.content:
DPRK Cabinet Hosts Reception for Junior Footballers 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet hosted a reception at the Okryu Restaurant Wednesday in honor of the football players and coaches who won the title of the 2014 AFC U-16 Championship. 
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) who doubles as chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet and chairman of the State Planning Commission who doubles as vice-chairman of the State Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, O Kum Chol, vice-chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, footballers and coaches. 
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae in a speech warmly congratulated the players and coaches on fully demonstrating the spirit of Songun Korea in the championship. 
					
					 They could win such a victory thanks to the warm care and belief shown by Marshal Kim Jong Un who has worked heart and soul for the development of the nation's sports, Choe said. 
					
					 He called upon all the players and coaches to intensify their training the way the anti-Japanese guerrillas did in Mt. Paektu and put sports of the country on the world level at an early date and fully exalt dignity and honor of thriving Korea by bagging more gold medals. 
					
					 Football player Jang Song Il in a reply speech extended the highest glory and deepest thanks to Kim Jong Un who projected them and showed warm loving care for them though they fulfilled their duties.
					
					 He renewed his will to reliably carry out the cause of building a sports power by bagging more gold medals, always bearing in mind the trust and expectation of the party.

articles.title: Int'l Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University Closes
articles.content:
Int'l Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University Closes
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The International Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University closed with due ceremony at the university on Wednesday. 
					 The symposium proved to be an international gathering for prestigious educators and scientists of universities in different countries as it provided a scientific foundation for properly understanding advantages of written and spoken Korean language and literary legacies and its long history.
					
					  Present at the closing ceremony were Thae Hyong Chol, president of Kim Il Sung University and concurrently minister of Higher Education, and officials, teachers and researchers of the university. 
					
					 Also present were delegations and delegates of different countries, Russian experts on Korean language and a delegation of Korean University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan. 
					
					 Choe Jong Ho, first vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, said in a closing address that the symposium attended by prominent scholars at home and abroad heard papers dealing with signal achievements made in properly understanding advantages of the written and spoken Korean language and literary legacies and its long history.
					
					 He expressed expectation that scholars of Kim Il Sung University and universities of different countries would make brisk exchange to further deepen the study of Korean linguistics, literature and history in the future, too.
					
					 A letter to supreme leader Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.
					
					 In the meantime, there were panel discussions and question-and-answer session as part of the symposium on the same day.

articles.title: Int'l Symposium Promotes Academic Ties
articles.content:
Int'l Symposium Promotes Academic Ties
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The International Scientific Symposium of Kim Il Sung University took place at the university on Sept. 23-24, under the theme of "Korean Linguistics, Literature and History".
					 Exchanged at the symposium, divided into sections of linguistics, literature and history, were successes and experience professors and scholars of universities and scientific institutes around the world gained in the study of the advantages of written and spoken Korean language and Korea's literary legacies and long history as well as their views.
					
					 Choe Jong Ho, first vice-president of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA:
					
					 The symposium promoted friendly ties and academic exchanges among universities and institutes and scholars. Its course showed that the strong academic ties and close cooperation among scholars majoring in Korea's language, literary legacies and history would be conducive to the development of human civilization in the 21st century.
					
					 The academic exchanges between scholars of Kim Il Sung University and their foreign fellows will get more lively in the future. 
					
					 So Jong In, a teacher of Korea University run by the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, said that the symposium offered an opportunity for making a deeper study of the Korean literature. Literature of Koreans in Japan is a part of the Korean literature, he said, evincing his resolve to fulfill the responsibility and duty in teaching written and spoken native language to the children of Korean residents in Japan and developing the national education.
					
					 Prof. Yannick Bruneton of University of Paris 7 said the symposium offered a lot of things to learn, stating that he would make all his possible efforts for brisk exchanges between Kim Il Sung University and his university.

articles.title: Scientific and Technological Workshop in Field of Greenhouse Vegetable Cultivation Held
articles.content:
Scientific and Technological Workshop in Field of Greenhouse Vegetable Cultivation Held
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological workshop in the field of the greenhouse vegetable cultivation took place here from Sept. 22 to 24 under the sponsorship of the Central Committee of the  General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea.
					 Attending it were officials of the Ministry of Agriculture and the Pyongyang Horticulture Guidance Bureau, and scientists, technicians and workers at the units for greenhouse vegetable cultivation and scientific institutions across the country.
					
					 There took place a lecture on technical issues arising in designing and building solar greenhouses and regulating the temperature inside greenhouses.
					
					 Its participants heard explanations about issues arising in scientifically and technologically growing hothouse vegetables and improving the technique and skill of the employees.
					
					 They also heard papers on the successes and experience gained in the scientific researches into increasing harvest and nutritive value of vegetables in greenhouses and production.

articles.title: Plant Protective Institute of Academy of Agricultural Science Marks Golden Jubilee
articles.content:
Plant Protective Institute of Academy of Agricultural Science Marks Golden Jubilee
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Plant Protective Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science marked its golden jubilee.
					 President Kim Il Sung made sure that the institute was founded on September 26, Juche 53 (1964) and wisely led it to contribute to protecting crops from all kinds of harmful insects and increasing agricultural production.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il provided the institute with modern facilities as required by the new century and indicated tasks and ways for killing noxious insects and taught ways for doing so.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un regarded agriculture and science as outposts for defending socialism and has shown profound loving care and trust for the scientists and technicians so that they might creditably fulfill their responsibilities and duties.
					
					 Over the past five decades the institute has developed and introduced efficacious agricultural chemicals for killing harmful insects and contributed to boosting agricultural production.
					
					 A meeting to mark the anniversary took place on Wednesday.

articles.title: Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Various Places
articles.content:
Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan Visits Various Places
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK led by Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, visited the Mirim Riding Club Wednesday.
					 Members of the group looked round various places of the club contributing to cultural and emotional life of working people and school youth and children as a comprehensive and modern riding service center.
					
					 Earlier, they toured the Rungna Dolphinarium and spent a pleasant time while enjoying skills presented by dolphins to cheerful music.
					
					 The group also visited the National Gifts Exhibition House, Songdowon International Children's Camp, Ryugyong Dental Hospital, Okryu Children's Hospital, etc.

articles.title: Anti-Ebola Campaign Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Anti-Ebola Campaign Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- A brisk campaign is going on in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea to prevent Ebola virus.
					 In this regard, Prof. and Dr. Choe Chang Sik, director of the Public Health Administration Institute under the Ministry of Public Health, told KCNA:
					
					 Some days ago the director of the Regional Office for South-East Asia of the World Health Organization called for raising awareness against Ebola.
					
					 At present, information activities and strict border quarantine are being conducted in the country. Foreign travelers and foreigners are subjected to a rigorous quarantine with advanced facilities.
					
					 Measures were also taken to develop preventive medicine against Ebola with regular hygienic and anti-epidemic work.
					
					 An official of the ministry said that Pyongyang City is taking the lead in the anti-Ebola campaign, adding medical workers in Rangnang District concentrate efforts on informing the inhabitants of Ebola virus and its damage.
					
					 Such information activities against Ebola can be seen in buses and other passenger transportation means.

articles.title: Train Service for Little Campers Starts in DPRK
articles.content:
Train Service for Little Campers Starts in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The train exclusively serving the Songdowon International Children's Camp started its operation in the DPRK.
					 According to an official of the Ministry of Railways, this shuttle train runs in three directions--between Songdowon Railway Station and Pyongyang, Chongjin and Haeju railway stations.
					
					 The train consists of locomotive, nine carriages, one wagon and one dining compartment.
					
					 As its first service, the train left Songdowon for Pyongyang on September 23, carrying children who spent pleasant days at the camp.
					
					 Rim Su Ryon, a teacher of Tongrim Junior Secondary School in Tongrim County, North Phyongan Province, told KCNA that the train service made her feel again the loving care shown by supreme leader Kim Jong Un for the rising generation.
					
					 Kang Hong Nam, a boy of Changjon Junior Secondary School in Pyongyang, said he would study harder to prepare himself to be a reliable builder of Songun Korea with Marshal Kim Jong Un's loving care always kept in mind.
					
					 Han Jong Son, chief engineman of the train "Songun Red Flag" No. 1, said that he would do his best to ensure safe train service, cherishing the supreme leader's warm love for posterity.

articles.title: Central Electric Power Designing Institute Marks Diamond Jubilee
articles.content:
Central Electric Power Designing Institute Marks Diamond Jubilee 
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Electric Power Designing Institute marked its diamond jubilee. 
					 President Kim Il Sung organized the institute, a special designing body of the power industry field, in Juche 43 (1954). 
					
					 The institute marks September 24 when the President paid his first visit to it. 
					
					 Over the past six decades the institute has developed into a prestigious designing body of the country with able designing forces and material foundation under the leadership and loving care of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu. 
					
					 It has advanced a lot of unique technical innovation proposals of Korean style and introduced them to projects, helping cut down the period for commissioning construction projects and economizing a huge amount of funds and materials and thereby bringing great benefits to the state. 
					
					 A meeting to mark the diamond jubilee took place on Wednesday. 
					
					 Present there were O Su Yong, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Kim Tok Hun, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, officials and employees of the institute. 
					
					 A congratulatory message of the WPK Central Committee to the designers and officials of the institute was conveyed at the meeting.
					
					 The congratulatory message highly praised the designers and officials for having achieved successes in the drive for implementing the party's policy on power industry with loyalty to the party and the leader and noble sense of moral obligation.

articles.title: Papers of Russia and Myanmar Carry Articles to Mark DPRK's 66th Birthday
articles.content:
Papers of Russia and Myanmar Carry Articles to Mark DPRK's 66th Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Papers of Russia and Myanmar carried special write-ups illustrated with photos of supreme leader Kim Jong Un in celebration of the 66th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Komsomolskaya Pravda on Sept. 9 carried an article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Un and invincible socialist state." It referred to the facts that President Kim Il Sung founded the DPRK and the President and leader Kim Jong Il developed it into an invincible socialist state.
					
					 It said Kim Jong Un is leading the drive to build an economic power based on the latest science and technology, consolidating the DPRK's position as a political, ideological and military power.
					
					 The Russian paper Moya Interesnaya Gazeta in its issue 9 ran an article titled "Fortress of independence", which said the DPRK is a country never affected by the imperialist policy of strength.
					
					 It dealt with the facts that Kim Jong Un decisively reacted to the vicious offensive staged by the U.S. imperialists and their allied forces to stifle the DPRK, pulling it up over its successful launch of the satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 and the third underground nuclear test.
					
					 The Myanmar paper The New Age on Sept. 5 carried an article titled "Invincible socialist state" introducing the DPRK, which has demonstrated its might as an invincible state as it is blessed with the illustrious leaders generation after generation.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Russian Media
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Russian Media
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- Russian media featured special write-ups from Sept. 11 to 13 to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The Russian paper Selskaya Zhizn carried an article titled "Independent country-DPRK" illustrated with a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 It is a serious lesson taught by international events in recent years that a country should have strength, first of all, in order to defend its sovereignty and peace.
					
					 Several countries are suffering the tragedy of bloodshed and collapse, their sovereignty and dignity infringed upon by imperialists as they are not strong enough to stand up against the aggression and interference by the latter.
					
					 However, there is a country which remains undeterred by the imperialist policy of strength. It is the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK, which is firmly defending its sovereignty and dignity from the imperialist allied forces, is instilling great confidence and courage into the countries aspiring after independence and dynamically advancing the cause of global independence.
					
					 The Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK posted on its website such articles as "Founder of DPRK", "Unforgettable leader of people" and "Invincible socialist power." They were illustrated with photos documenting the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Articles introducing the victorious and glorious path covered by the DPRK were posted on internet magazines including Hanber Journal and websites of the Rostov Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, the Crimean Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Anti-Globalization Movement.

articles.title: WPK Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
WPK Praised by British Organization
 Pyongyang, September 24 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy featured on its website articles accompanied with a photo of the flag of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on September 18 on the occasions of the 17th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the WPK and the 69th founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 An article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il's outlook on people" said:
					
					Since the start of his work at the Central Committee of the WPK, he wisely led the party officials to be responsible for the destiny of the people and take care of them like a mother dedicating herself to her children.
					
					 In those days, the people keenly realized how noble his viewpoint and attitude toward them was.
					
					 He always shared joy and sorrow with people, considering them as his teachers and the most powerful beings and deeming it as his mission to build a paradise where their independence comes true.
					
					 The Korean people miss him very much and entrust all their destinies and future to the WPK, calling it mother.
					
					 Another article titled "Flag of WPK" noted that the Korean people are dynamically advancing to build a thriving nation as early as possible, holding aloft the flag of the WPK as an invincible banner

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Guinea-Bissau
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al presidente de Guinea-Bissau 
 Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 20 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Guinea-Bissau, Jose Mario Vaz, con motivo del 41o aniversario de proclamacion de esa republica.
					 Convencido de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran invariablemente tambien en el futuro, el remitente desea al mandatario y a su pueblo exitos en los trabajos para la unidad y estabilidad nacionales y el desarrollo economico del pais.

articles.title: Se activa en RPDC la campana preventiva de Ebola
articles.content:
Se activa en RPDC la campana preventiva de Ebola 
 Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Toma auge en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la lucha por prevenir el virus de Ebola que causa seria preocupacion en la palestra mundial.
					 El Prof. y doctor Choe Chang Sik, director del Instituto de Administracion de Salud Publica adscrito al Ministerio de Salud Publica, dijo como sigue:
					
					 Hace poco, el director de la Oficina de la Region del Sudeste Asiatico de la Organizacion Mundial de la Salud (OMS) exhorto a levantar la guardia sobre el virus de Ebola.
					
					 Aunque todavia no se ha reportado ningun contagiado en la zona encargada por esa oficina, pensamos que no se debe relajar la vigilancia.
					
					 Ahora, en la RPDC se intensifica la propaganda sobre esa enfermedad y se torna rigurosa la cuarentena sobre los viajantes a ultramar y los visitantes extranjeros.
					
					 Por otra parte, se desarrolla la medicina de prevencion de la enfermedad Ebola.
					
					 Un funcionario del Ministerio de Salud Publica expreso a la ACNC que los funcionarios medicos del municipio de Raknang de la ciudad de Pyongyang son ejemplares en la campana preventiva de Ebola.
					
					 Los medicos de las policlinicas de ese municipio realizan sustancialmente la propaganda sobre los sintomas y danos de ese virus.

articles.title: Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete en honor de futbolistas y entrenadores
articles.content:
Consejo de Ministros ofrece banquete en honor de futbolistas y entrenadores
 Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 24 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de los jugadores y entrenadores que vencieron en el campeonato sub-16 de la Confederacion Asiatica de Futbol 2014.
					 En la recepcion estuvieron presentes Choe Ryong Hae, secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y presidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, Ro Tu Chol, vicepremier y presidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion y vicepresidente del Comite Estatal de Direccion de Deportes, Ri Ryong Nam, ministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, O Kum Chol, subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea, y otros funcionarios, jugadores y entrenadores.
					
					 Al hacer uso de la palabra, Choe Ryong Hae felicito a los futbolistas y entrenadores que demostraron el impetu de la Corea del Songun en dicho campeonato asiatico.
					
					 Dijo que la victoria de ellos se debe al amor y la fe del Mariscal Kim Jong Un quien trabaja incansablemente para desarrollar el deporte nacional.
					
					 Subrayo que todos los jugadores y entrenadores deben levantar la ola de ejercicios por el estilo del monte Paektu para situar en el nivel mundial el deporte nacional y exaltar a todo el mundo la dignidad y el honor de la Corea prospera ganando mas medallas de oro.
					
					 En el discurso de respuesta, el jugador Jang Song Il rindio la maxima gloria y expreso agradecimiento al Mariscal que dispensa benevolencias a los futbolistas que no hicieron nada mas que cumplir su deber.
					
					 Manifesto la firme decision de apoyar la causa de construccion de potencia deportiva con las medallas de oro para no defraudar la confianza y esperanza del Partido.

articles.title: CM ofrece banquete en honor de participantes en festival de cine
articles.content:
CM ofrece banquete en honor de participantes en festival de cine 
 Pyongyang, 24 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 24 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo un banquete en honor de los participantes en el XIV Festival Internacional de Cine de Pyongyang. 
					 Fueron invitados a la recepcion las delegaciones y delegados de varios paises participantes en el festival y los miembros del jurado internacional. 
					
					 Estuvieron presentes el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Cultura y presidente del comite organizador del festival, Pak Chun Nam, y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					 Al hacer uso de la palabra, Kim Yong Jin senalo que los participantes en el festival cooperaron bien por la marcha exitosa del certamen y subrayo que los dias del festival dejaran en el corazon de los participantes como inolvidable recuerdo.
